page.title: 03WAYSIDE CROSS
page.content: There is a {wayside cross }at the top of Winson Hill. Some people call it { {Winson Cross.}Others may call it a wayside cross. It is there because pilgrims prayed there. It was their first sight of the church tower at {Chittlehampton.}They prayed for{Saint {Urith.} The cross is made from granite because that is a strong stone. When Saint Urith was martyred in Chittlehampton a spring came up and the pilgrims came to see the spring and to wash in it to get healed by its waters if they were sick.
